The thrift shop didn't have a lot that caught his eye, but just before he left, Deku saw two metal coins, one gold and the other silver. Their inscriptions caught his eye, but they were labeled at two-thousand yen each. His spending money was limited, and he didn't want to spend everything on these two coins.

He'd already finished his homework, and studied enough heroes and fighting techniques for the day. Lying on his bed, he took out the coin and looked at the words gracing its surface. "Shape What You Were," he muttered to himself. Being born quirkless, despite his drive to become a hero, had been a curse, one that had led to his bullying as a child. Yet now, he was the new owner of One For All, the successor to All Might. There were so many what ifs in his head, and he couldn't help saying one aloud.

He turned swiftly to leer at her, with a wink. "The one and only. You miss me?" His tongue was practically waggling out of his mouth. Mikuru eeped, covering herself reflexively. Suzumiya could only cackle in his usual amusement. "Come on! You call yourselves men? Let's get going!"

Haruki frowned, looking at himself for the first time. He did feel... different. Something had changed. Something important. He rubbed his chin, feeling the traces of facial hair against his palm. Had he forgotten to shave? He could've sworn his cheeks were usually softer than this.

...Hadn't he been wearing a skirt earlier?

But he quickly shook the thought of his mind. That would be far too strange. Wouldn't it? Maybe? He felt his confidence wavering and he didn't like that.

"Nope! Hurry up- last one to the front of the school has to pay for bus fare!" And he raced out the room quickly, away from the threats to his new existence. He somehow managed another leer at Mikuru's chest as he did so.

Kyon turned immediately to his most trusted adviser. "Yuki, what the hell's going on?"

The resident alien interface close her book slowly. "At 3:16 PM, the Integrated Data Thought Entity observed an energy spike from Haruhi Suzumiya. Unlike many of the energy spikes, it appears to have remained around Haruhi Suzumiya herself rather than force itself upon the world. There als-"

Koizumi was already checking his phone. "Its only 3:18. She must have only just now changed. And I'm not sensing any new Closed Spaces."

"So, what, that really is Haruhi?"

"So it would seem..." The philosopher turned to Mikuru. "I don't suppose you've gotten any messages from your own organization."

Mikuru fiddled with her skirt anxiously. "Nothing yet. I don't think they consider it important..."

Koizumi stroked his chin. "I always wondered if the future even cared about gender. If they've passed the Singularity where you're from, gender might be considered rather trivial."

"That's classified."

"Hold on." Kyon quickly lifted up his hands. "We're getting off-topic. Why on Earth did Haruhi do... that?"

"Who can say? Every day, we are inundated with reminders of our gender. We've invented roles and stereotypes and social structures around them. Perhaps Suzumiya grew jealous of the benefits of the male life. Or perhaps she simply grew tired of a female body. Or perhaps, she's abandoned both. Maybe this body, as masculine as it appears, is the closest to a genderless specimen she could achi-"

Oh brother grumbled Kyon internally. The last thing we need is another lecture from the wannabe philosopher. He refocused his attention on Yuki. "I don't suppose you know what she's thinking."

Nagato considered the request carefully. It seemed Kyon and the others had little interest in learning of another data spike surrounding Haruhi's acquisition of a small gold coin. She filed away the information for later, just in case. "Haruhi Suzumiya is currently experiencing an influx in testosterone, among other biological changes. A few synapses in her brain have altered, particularly in areas featuring names and similar memetic information. She, or rather he, likely considers himself completely male and used to the social expectations that title offers on Earth. Haruhi Suzumiya is now Haruki Suzumiya"

Koizumi nodded slowly. "Then there we have it."

"Sure, we may have it, but what are we supposed to do with it? We can't let her- him go around like that. Its not like anyone else knows... 'Haruki.'" Kyon made sure to shove airquotes around the name.

"But pushing the matter may shock Suzumiya and lead to far more drastic changes." The esper shrugged pleasantly. "I say we indulge our new Commander and await an inevitable return to her normal self."

Kyon groaned. The philosopher always wanted to play things safe. He was getting sick of it. But maybe he had a point. What else could they do, with someone as powerful as Haruhi- Haruki going this off-course?

There were no guards in sight, the dungeon entirely abandoned with the sole exception of the cage and the woman occupying it. Peach walked up to the edge, grasping the thick metal bars in her dainty hands. It seemed like the only possible way out would be through breaking or bending the bars, but Bowser himself was perhaps the only person in the world strong enough to do so. Still, with a faint hope in her chest and a magical coin around her neck, Peach tugged as hard as she could on the bars, trying to bend them in opposite directions.

The gold coin hanging flush to her chest could read her thoughts and obliged her. Just when she was about to give up on this foolish enterprise, Peach felt the bars start to move, if only ever so slightly. Surprised, she dedoubled her efforts and watched as slowly but surely the metal groaned and moved. What she didn't see was a large turtle shell forming on her back, or her shoulders widening as her build become thicker and more hardy. New strength surged through her, the bars bending quicker, as her arms grew more muscular and the muscles all over her body followed suit, expanding and compacting. The smile on her face became a snarl as her face elongated out into a snout filled with razor sharp teeth, her pale fleshy skin replaced with scales, and her bright blonde hair turned a bright red. The whole she was making was almost large enough for her growing form when her stomach began packing on some pounds, growing a small budgy belly that was accentuated by her now larger breasts. A tail grew, spiked, and slithered out of her shell, and the last things to change were her hands and feet, growing claws and scales themselves. As Peach surveyed her handywork, now able to escape the cage, she looked down and saw the body of a Royal Koopa, not too different in size and shape from Bowser, was now her own.

To a weak, sniveling, worthless human, of course that's how Royal Koopas seemed. But being one now, she knew the truth: they were just amazing. She was stronger than anyone she'd ever met, and Peach knew that like it was a fact, like how things fell with you dropped them. Looking back, she envied Bowser now. 1422.content:
Link was frustrated. The Great Deku Tree had told him to meet “the Princess of Destiny” in Hyrule Castle and stop the man from his nightmares. The castle guards, however, did not seem to take the word of the Great Deku Tree as highly as he did. Dejected he made his way back to the market, perhaps the bazaar would have something that could help him get inside the castle.

He was on his way down to the bazaar when a strange-looking store caught his eye. According to the large sign above the door, it was a… mask shop? Wondering why there would be an entire shop dedicated to solely selling masks, he decided to put his quest on hold and indulge his curiosity.

When he attempted to open the door and walk inside he found that the door was locked. Somewhat depressed by the fact that he had been denied entry to two places in one day he sighed and was about to turn and leave when he heard the door unlock. It swung open to reveal a skinny, orange-haired man with an eerie grin on his face.

“So sorry about that, I’m just starting to get ready for the day.” He then stepped aside, motioning for Link to enter the building. “But you’re free to look around while I set up shop.” Part of Link was telling him he should leave and get back to his Quest, but he ultimately gave in to his curiosity and entered the store.

As he moved inside, he heard the door shut behind him has the shop owner walked across the room at sat down behind the counter. Behind him was a wide variety of masks which ranged from colorful and childlike, to downright creepy.

“I’m afraid I don’t have any masks available for sale right now.” He said, even though there were plenty of masks behind him. He then pulled what a small wooden box from beneath the counter and positioned it so Link could have a clear view. ”However, I believe these will allow you to solve your problem quite easily.” He opened the box to reveal two ornate coins, one gold, and one silver.

Link, oblivious to the fact the shopkeeper seemed to be aware of his current dilemma regarding the castle, decided to go ahead and make a purchase.
1422.title: Legend of Zelda

choices: Attempt to enter Hyrule Castle again
14221.content:
Link took a look at how many rupees he had on him and it looked like he could only afford one. “I think I’ll take the gold one.” He said, figuring gold meant it was somehow better than the silver one.

The shopkeeper’s grin widened as he nodded and eagerly took Link’s rupees. He then handed the gold coin to Link. He took the coin, flipping it in his hands as he examined both sides.

“All you have to do is keep it on your person, and it will work it’s magic!” Link was about to look up and ask what he meant by that, but the shopkeep quickly moved into a back room, leaving Link alone in the store.

Link pocketed the coin and went outside, and found himself standing in front of the store as he wondered what to do next.

14231111.content:
As Phoenix Wright, famed turnabout attorney left the office he had one thing on his mind. Food. He hadn't eaten anything all day and was going to spend his last dollar on a nice cheap burger before he would let himself worry about the fact he hadn't gotten a case or a paycheck in months. Well that wasn't true, he'd taken on a number of cases for friends and neighbors but they couldn't afford another lawyer and knew Phoenix didn't have the heart to charge more than they could afford. But good will does not pay the bills. As the weight of the world was starting to bare down on Phoenix he passed a small shop where there was an argument inside.

"I demand you lower the price! This is outrageous! I can find better products than this in a trash can!"

"Then go to a trash can where you belong you filth. Leave my shop!"

"Not until I get some money back!"

"If you don't leave now I'll curse you so hard your children will suffer!" Phoenix looked into the shop to see a very frustrated looking old man waving what seemed to be voodoo doll in the customers face. Phoenix was surprised to see that he recognized that customer, it was prosecutor Paine.

"I'll have you arrested and your store shut down!" Paine squeezed with his familiar shrill voice.

"Gentlemen! Please calm down, no need to fight!" Phoenix decided he needed to step in before this escalated.

"I'll happily leave if I get my money back. This was supposed to give me my hair back but they did nothing." Paine slammed down a silver coin on the counter. The shop owner rolled his eyes, "Than you should have gotten the gold one, it cost the same."

"I don't care about coins, just give me my money back and I'll find some other not shabby shop to give my money too."

"No refunds!" The old man said intently looking ready to do something bad with the voodoo doll.

"Gentlemen! No need to fight! Paine, how much was the coin. We'll try to work something out."

"1 dollar."

Phoenix stood stunned for a moment, "1 dollar? Really?" Paine nodded and Phoenix groaned, "Fine, I'll give you the dollar for the shop own, will you leave peacefully?" Phoenix said as he shoved his last dollar into Paine's chest. Paine took it and considered, "Fine. But I'll keep an eye on you."

"Good for you." The old man growled as Paine left the shop. Phoenix went to check on the old man, "Are you ok sir?"

"Yes I am sonny, I could have taken care of him myself, but I don't like to flex my muscles unless I have to." The old man said as he cracked his fingers.

"Right, well, have a nice day." Phoenix said as he turned to leave thinking he might have some stale cereal leftover in the office. But the old man stopped him, "Wait! I can't let you leave empty handed, please, look around my shop. Take whatever you want free of charge."

"Oh no, I couldn't."

"Please take what you wish, I insist."

Phoenix gave a glance around the shop to see if there was anything he could get for the office but decided against it, he didn't want to take advance of the old man's kindness. He looked down at the coins the he knew were being sold for cheap and decided they were the best way to take payment without taking anything too valuable.

Before he could fully parse what that meant, he arrived at People Park, the designated rendezvous point for him and Mr. Wright. He had went over the case details briefly, apparently some shmuck named Stuart Pidman had been caught skulking about the park right around the time some festival fireworks had gone haywire. Normally the police'd chalk it up as an accident and go about their business, but since the Kitaki family had been funding the whole festival, they insisted that it must have been sabotage. "The police may not catch the crook at first, but at least they know when the Kitakis want something, that they get something." Apollo snidely mused to himself.

After waiting around the gates for a minute or two, Apollo was greeted with a spiky-haired man in a bright blue suit practically sprinting towards the gate. 'The old Detention Center Dash,) thought Apollo.

"You're Pauline, I presume." said Phoenix, having mostly caught his breath after a minute's break. "I'm really sorry about the short notice, but I really needed an assistant for this outing. They're barring the crime scene in two hours, Ema needs someone to grouse and do forensics with or she gets all pouty, I need to be briefed on the evidence by the detective, and I forgot my Magatama at—

"It's quite all right." said Apollo with a warm smile. Typical Phoenix, burning the candle at both ends again. "I may be an..." He wracked his brain for the one-second backstory Trucy gave him. "Illusionist by trade, but I've always been interested in crime scenes. Odd hobby for a gu — GIRL like me to have, I've been told." They both shared a laugh together, Apollo secretly hoping that Phoenix didn't see through his paper-thin backstory.

They chatted for a bit as they went into the park, Apollo not entirely engaged due to his shock at how tall Mr. Wright seemed now. After their conversation came to an end, Phoenix gave Apollo a short briefing on their individual tasks.

"Alright, I'm going to go talk to some witnesses and the detective, while you'll be a deputy forensic investigator with Ema over there." Apollo was walking away before he heard Phoenix cry out to him. "Hey, wait up a moment!" Turning around, Apollo put his hands to his mouth in surprise at what Phoenix was holding. It was the golden coin — Apollo not even realized that it had fallen from his 'Victoria's Secret compartment' when he absentmindedly shoved it in there. "I think you might have dropped this earlier, Pauline — I saw it glinting on the path just a second ago." Apollo reached out for the coin, profusely thanking Phoenix, until he jerked it back. "Umm... Are you sure you don't want me to hang on to this? I don't think you have any pockets and the other ways to keep it safe are.... less secure." Phoenix mumbled the last part, a practically luminescent blush on his face.

Apollo thought for a second and said...

As the Gavinners took the stage Apollo had to cover his ears, not from the music coming from the speakers but the wild and crazy cheers from the fans (mostly teenage girls). High pitched wails of joy were like knives in Apollo's ears. He wasn't even sure if his Chordes of Steel could drown them out. It was so bad he actually welcomed the pounding base that began coming from the speaker by his ear drowning out the cheers. And it wasn't just the sound that was going nuts, the visuals were also out of control. Apollo looked up to see Klavier being lowered down with his signature guitar on the gigantic scales of justice set up on the stage all highlighted by what seemed like 1000 flashing lights.

Apollo felt a headache coming on so he just closed his eyes and tried to focus on something good. He was here with friends, and they were happy so that made him happy. And the beat coming through the speaker actually wasn't bad. Now that he was listening to it, Apollo had to admit that Klavier was a really good musician. Apollo actually felt a smile forming on his face. And his toes were even tapping along with the beat. Something that the coin in his pocket took notice of.

The brown dress shoes that Apollo always wore even when he wasn't lawyering began to open themselves up and began to elevate until they turned into a pair of heeled sandals. The magic then began to spread up Apollo's legs turning his red pants into an easy to move and dance in skirt. Apollo unconsciously took advantage and began to shimmy his legs and shake his now expanding hips. Apollo kept dancing getting his upper body into it that now was becoming more female gaining all the necessary parts as his vest and button up shirt turning into a white blouse and a cute red scarf with the Gavinner's logo on it. As the Gavinner's began to play a more rocking number Apollo began to headbang to the music letting his growing brown hair go wild. And yet his signature devil horns stayed in tact. It seemed there were some things not even magic could change.

Apollo with his eyes still closed and having not yet noticed his changes kept getting more and more wild in his dancing, after all he was loving this music more and more, until he found that he had bumped into someone. Apollo finally opened his eyes and saw that someone was holding onto his arm.
14231121311.title: Apollo enjoys the music turning him into a fangirl

choices: Apollo notices how his body has changed and freaks out on stage
Apollo and Klavier are both holding the gold coin and begin to change
The coin has fallen and been picked up by a slightly jealous Athena
142311213112.content:
"And now it is time to debut the Gavineer's newest hit song! Would you like to hear it, ya?" The silky smooth voice of Klavier Gavin proclaimed to the thousands of fans in attendence who all voiced their approval, but no one shouted louder with her chords of steel than the Gavineer's new #1 fan Apollo. Something about that voice stuck out to Klavier, it reminded him of the comfort and rush of the courtroom. With his cocky/charming smile he told the crowd his plan. "Ya my musical family, it is a song from the heart, a song of love. But ze words would just be words unless I had someone to sing them to. Do I have any volunteers?"

There was a near riot in the crowd as thousands of excited fan girl's tried to get Klavier's attention so he could serenade them with a love song just for them. But once again the booming female voice from the back area stood out, Klavier made eye contact with the lovely young woman clad in Gavinner's garb with wonderful brown hair that had two odd horn shapes in the front that reminded him of a certain someone. Klavier made his decision, there was something special about this girl, something magical even and he was drawn to her. With an air of confidence, Klavier made his way towards Trucy's crew where the brown haired girl was waiting. He smiled his million dollar smile that was on posters and merchandise world wide and offered his hand to the girl. Instantly the girl screened and shattered a few ear drums of the security guards around her. Klavier brought the girl out on the stage onto one half of the giant scales of justice prop. "What is your name my liebling?"

"My friends call me Polly sometimes." Apollo said unable to believe this, Klavier knew him, why was he asking his name? And why was he so excited to see him, to be talking to him. Klavier usually was someone Apollo tried to avoid at all cost, but now he couldn't look away, he loved his music so much. And what was he saying earlier? He was going to sing a special song to a special someone? Was that him?

"Ya Polly, I want you to take my hands, look me in the eyes, and enjoy the ride." Klavier winked as the band began to play and the scales of justice began to rise, and Klavier began to sing. Apollo was entranced by his words, they were the words of a man talking to the woman he loved, the woman he wanted to marry. And nothing, not the law, not the earth, not heaven nor hell would break their powerful bond. Apollo was thrilled to be getting a personal moment during a Gavinner's concert, after all, he was their newest biggest fan. But Apollo wondered why Klavier picked him instead of a girl?
142311213112.title: It's Klavier has a special plan for his newest fan

1423311.title: Which one?

14233111.content: One of the guys, or one of the girls?
14233111.title: A phantom thief.

1423311112.content:
Ryuji kicked a rock walking through Shibuya. The thieves had come up with their plan to trick Akechi and his employers, but something just didn't sit right with Ryuji. He knew that he couldn't just go up to Akechi and call him out — he'd probably get him, his friends, and his family killed, but...

Ryuji balled his hand into a fist. 'I just feel so goddamn WEAK!' But before he could punch a wall or do something equally rash, he caught sight of a store he hadn't seen before. It's next to that weird-ass place where Joker gets all the model guns. Might as well go take a look, get my mind off of things.

Unfortunately, nothing inside was really within his price range, or his interest — all formaldehyde preserved dead things and weird Western knick-knacks. But something caught his eye in a dusty display shelf near the front. Two coins, one gold, and one silver. He squinted to make out the words on them - was that English? But after blinking once or twice, it turns out it was perfectly readable Japanese.

'Become What You Seek and Shape What You Were? Those sound like Phantom Thief values if I've ever seen them!' He turned to the old shopkeep. "Yo, Gramps, how much are these?"

"300 yen apiece, my dear boy." Ryuji gulped. He had about 630 yen, and if he bought both, he couldn't get a drink for the jog back to his house.

After thinking for a bit, Ryuji...
1423311112.title: Ryuji.

14233111122.content:
Ryuji walked out of the alleyway, a Pocari in his hand and a grin on his face. Silver fit the whole Phantom Thief schtick better, anyways.
He absentmindedly scratched his head — what should he do now?
14233111122.title: Silver Thief

choices: "I wish I had it like you did, Ann."
"I wish I could be just a model student like Nijima."
142331111222.content:
A few days later, Ryuji and Ann had a study meeting in the Shibuya Diner. Ms. Usami had been hinting at a math test coming up, and the two blondes were certainly unprepared for this.

Ryuji had been staring at his textbook for around four minutes before he snapped.

"Rrrgh, GodDAMMIT!" He slammed his book shut loud enough to echo through the diner.

Ann jerked her head up and fixed him with a venomous glare. "Jeez, Ryuji, calm the hell down! It's hard, but read it enough and it'll stick." She rolled her eyes and was about to replant her nose firmly in the book before Ryuji cut in.

"I mean, you're right, but... Eh, never mind, it's bullshit anyways."

Ann lifted her eyes up. "C'mon, you've never been this secretive before. Hell, you practically scream out that we're Phantom Thie—"

"It's just in class, everyone just," Ryuji blurted, interrupting her dig at him. "I can just feel everyone just lookin' at me, seein' some punk who fucked up his whole track career. I can hear their whispers behind my back and it... It makes it so goddamn hard to focus!"

"Ryuji..." Ann laid a sympathetic hand on his.

"I just.... I just want something different! I _________."
142331111222.title: A Model Study Meeting

1423311113.content: The artist or the detective prince?
1423311113.title: Yusuke or Akechi?

choices: A set of coins — one silver and one golden.
14233111132.content:
A screaming swathe of girls — and some men — rushed past the alley in Shinjuku.

"WHERE IS HE?" The echo of their shrill cries echoed through the ward, even into the shop where the Detective Prince, their target, was hiding.

Akechi sighed to himself. The attention was nice, but crowds like this got annoying after a while. Some girl saw him when he was staking out Okumura Foods and sent out an alert to the 'Akechi Fan Club 'All it takes are a few fake cases and the sheep are following me around like I'm holding hay!' A voice laughed in the back of his head. Goro quickly silenced it — this was a time to be the Detective Prince, not the Black Knight.

"Excuse me?" A voice quavered from the front of the store. Akechi looked askance at the source — he hadn't actually wanted to talk to anyone today, so this was certainly inconvenient.

Regardless, he put on his most winning smile and approached the counter. "Hello there. My apologies, I was trying to hide, and your stor—" He stopped, realizing how suspicious he sounded. He quickly backpedaled. "Ah, not in any criminal sense, I assure you. Just a horde of fans. You see, I'm —."

"Goro Akechi." The old man finished, to Akechi's mild annoyance. 'YOU THINK YOU CAN INTERRUPT ME, YOU DODDERING FOSSIL!', The Knight in his head screamed, just in time for Akechi to shove it back down.

"I saw you on the television." The storekeep grasped Akechi's gloved hands with his quavering pair. "Y-You don't realize how much you've done for me... For this country!"

'That's right old fool, lick my boots. It's what you pawns are best at, anyways.' For once, Akechi let the Knight stay around for a bit. He did have a point this time.

The old man continued, tears in his eyes. "M-my son. He was on the train that crashed in April." Akechi's smile dropped quickly. The Knight was silent. "And to think you found the man who did it. It's heroes like you that let an old man me know that our country is in good hands."

Akechi could barely recall the following ten minutes. They were vague shapes in his head — he managed to fix his smile back on his face, the old man cried for some time, and said more things to him. Akechi smiled and nodded, but everything that came out of the man's mouth sounded like static.

The old man folded something into his hands, and Akechi politely opened the door, waved goodbye, and promptly vomited into the nearby trash can.

He feebly looked at what the old man gave him. It was ______________. Akechi shoved it into his pockets without a second thought and began the trek home, flipping the barely-used hood over his head.

People who looked at him on his way back didn't see a gallant Prince or a fierce Knight. They just saw another lonely soul walking back to an empty home.
14233111132.title: Prince's Retreat.

142331111321.content:
Akechi spent the next day moping in his apartment. He turned the TV on to his appearances on television to cheer him up, but the no avail. He pulled out the silver coin the old man gave him, going over yesterday in his head. He flipped it once or twice, the old man's words echoing in his head: "Heroes like you."

The Knight tried to comfort him, uncharacteristically. 'It's just a bunch of stepping stones, all for the old man to see how far he's fallen. The ends justify the means.' Akechi rallied himself, sitting up straighter. That's right. It'll all be for good in the end. They'd thank me if they knew.

But then, the TV he had absentmindedly turned on was showing a familiar program: His mid-june interview

The Prince spoke on screen. "I believe the Phantom Thieves should be tried in a court of law. Madarame did commit an unforgivable crime, but what the Thieves did is no different. They're taking the law into their own hands — an act far from justice."

Akechi watched the program unfold with wide eyes, the coin slipping from his grasp and rolling onto the floor. Suddenly, he let out a guttural cry and let the remote fly at the hapless screen — breaking it beyond repair.

He raged, "WHAT DO YOU KNOW? You're just some brat playing at being detective, just to get a pat on the back! And those goddamn thieves think they're better than ME? Just because they have their stupid little group and eachoth-." His voice faltered, and he broke into tears.

He collapsed to the floor, amidst the shards of broken glass and the discarded coin, sobbing.

"I j-just wanna _______." He cried out, his first bit of honesty in over four years.
142331111321.title: A silver coin.

choices: Prepare to do his (new) duties as a teacher.
Try to venture into the Metaverse immediately.
1423311113211.content:
Akechi sobbed out his wish, prostrate on the floor. The coin was kind enough to grant it. It shone bright enough to stop his weeping, bright enough to match the sun outside, bright enough to send everything into darkness in its absence.

Everything that surrounded him was nothing. There was no point of reference, no way to get your bearings, simply an absence. There was nothing to see, touch, smell, hear. All that there was was an insurmountable feeling of pressure. No actual substance to press down on you, but the anechoic nothing there to smother all sense. He tried to breathe, but no air moved. It remained still. He remained still. All was still.

But as rapidly as the void had materialized, so did something else. The color was a welcome change from nothing at all, and Akechi greedily drank it all in. The room was small, but emanated a sense of coziness, not claustrophobia. The walls, ceiling, and floor were all made of a plush blue material. And oddest of all, a short squat man with a long hooked nose sat in the center. Akechi recognized the man almost immediately and went to shout — but nothing came out.

Igor gave a start. "Oh!" The voice that came out was certainly not the deep, unsettling rumble that Akechi was used to, but was a reedy almost-whisper that held a grandfatherly tone to it. Igor cleared his throat. "Pardon me, I haven't much for visitors ever since my rival proved a most poor sport." He chuckled to himself, before looking left and right, as if for someone. "I am sure that he shall meet the same fate as countless others have before him, but for now, we must do with minimal accouterments. Now, what brings you to this room?" He did not wait for a response but merely squinted his eyes for a second, before widening them in surprise. "Oh my. The pawn of my rival, pulled across time and space by..." He rubbed his chin in contemplation. "A third party, shall we say. But we must not neglect your own dissatisfaction that led you down this twisted path. A tragedy indeed..." He trailed off.

Akechi fumed in the absent space where he maybe-resided. Igor raised a conciliatory hand. "I do not mean to assume your past nor struggles, Guest, I merely was making my own observations. But I do have something to offer you. It is a chance to walk a new path, paved by your own choices, not that of powers that conspire to toss you aside like a broken plaything. Would you accept this deal, Guest?"

Goro raised the space where his eyebrows might occupy. Did he deserve a second chance? Probably not, he had killed more people than anyone else in Shido's twisted conspiracy — something about this room promoted self-honesty, apparently. 'But that wasn't the question, was it?' Akechi mused. He may not deserve it, but he sure as hell wanted it, and that would be good enough for now. He nodded his not-head, at which Igor's grin grew slightly wider for a second. "Lovely. Even though it may interfere with the game between my rival and myself, I am truly honored to place another piece on the board. I am afraid that this may be the last meeting you have with me or my ilk. You may not be a Wild Card anymore, but you are certainly still a player."

Igor conjured a card, one with an image of an angel pouring water, and held it in his hand. As swiftly as he materialized it, he crushed it in his hand, and wafted the dust towards the Akechi-space. And then everything went black, save that of Igor's final statement to him.

~~You truly were a remarkable guest.~~


The darkness dissipated much faster than it did beforehand, leaving Akechi gasping. He woke up a bed, covered with a thick comforter. His eyes flicked left to right, his heart beating like a hammer. The room was certainly different, its walls smaller than before, and the floor generally disheveled. It seemed to be a studio apartment, a massive downgrade from his previous penthouse. 'It doesn't matter as long as it's different.' He repeated over and over again in his head. His hope spiked when he saw a tearaway calendar on the far wall. He needed to see if it wasn't too late, if Shido wasn't. His scramble to the wall was abruptly stopped when all of his weight redistributed itself incredibly oddly. In short, he fell flat on his ass. Which was a lot softer than normal. And the liquid sloshing on his chest was weird too. His mad rush for the wall was exchanged for a mad rush to the bathroom.

Akechi poked and prodded in mounting horror at various parts. His lips were larger, his eyelashes longer, his hair darker and silky smooth. Everything that wasn't a complete change was just different enough to be disconcerting. Even moving was weird. Everything just had a new softness to it that wasn't there before. He didn't even want to look at his chest, which was well enough concealed by a large baggy t-shirt, used as makeshift pajamas. He froze. How did he know that? Was he losing his mind? Akechi took a deep breath in, and tried to collect himself. He was Goro Akechi, sent back (Sadayo Kawakami) in time by some weird — there it was again!

He prodded at the new voice in the back of his head — mostly used to balancing the Prince and the Knight, this type of one was new. It didn't provide 'commentary', like the always-angry Knight, but it also wasn't some other mask to wear, like the Prince was. What he quickly found out about it (to his great relief) was that it wasn't some angry parasite trying to subsume him. It was like a teacher, there to guide him through the new unfamiliar processes of his new life. With a bit of prodding and experimenting, he found out who he was in this brave new world.

You're a teacher at Shujin Academy. You're a Japanese teacher, and you try to stay away from Kamoshida, because... The voice faded into static at this point, at couldn't be pressed any more. You work a part time job to pay the bills, and you CANNOT get close to your students. Not again. No further questioning could press this point either.

But more importantly than some minor troubles, Akechi learned something vital. It was April 9th, and he would have to sit in on the orientation of a transfer student tomorrow. If he pressed deeper, the voice gave him lesson plan upon lesson plan, the flood of which nearly overwhelmed him.

What he also found out was that the voice could also serve as a handy autopilot for the things he absolutely had no idea to do. If he just kept his head up and let his mind go blank, he could have the voice put on a bra without having to look at the new globes on his chest, take a shower without him having to actually touch all of his... 'new parts'. It could even get dressed without his input! All in all, it was a small favor he was incredibly thankful for. 'Thank God I don't have to deal with all of this shit at once.'

But the shit he did have to deal with was immediate as it was important. What would he do next?
1423311113211.title: The Prince's First Lesson

142333221.content: And who comes across the coins?
142333221.title: Life is going to be getting stranger

14331.content: Who shall be receiving the coins (first)?
14331.title: How I Changed My Life

143312.content:
Now kids, this happened right after Barney and your Aunt Robin broke up. That weekend, he and Aunt Lily we're drinking together at MacLaren's. They were pretty tipsy by this point...

The two sat at a table together, flushed and frustrated. Other people were beginning to take notice of their argument and glare, which they did not notice in the slightest. "You're only able to sleep around because you're a guy! If I skadoodled as many people as you, people would call me a slut!"

"Ha!" Barney scoffed, drinking more of his twelth beer. "Priviledge, smiviledge! I..." Suddenly an idea occurred to him, piercing through his hazy drunk mind. "I bet that as a women, I could have just as much sex as I do now and have everyone still know how awesome I am! Challenge accepted!"

And with that he disappeared from the bar, leaving Lily sitting there confused and annoyed.

What none of us knew at the time was that your Uncle Barney had bought two magical coins, and yes I'm being serious here, from some thrift shop years before this. He'd studied them and figured out what they could do way ahead of time without telling any of us. He'd saved them for a good bet, and now that he had an excuse to use them he was going to take it. He gathered the whole gang together at his apartment...

"Ladies and gentleman," he began, unaffected by the annoyed expressions of all his friends. "I have brought you tonight to commence the bet I made with Lily three night before! With this magic coin," he said, holding up a silver coin, "I can reshape my past! And I shall use it's might to prove that my awesomeness transcends gender barriers and stereotypes!" He paused meaningfully before saying, "What if I was..."
143312.title: How To Be Awesome

choices: Bailey easily slips into her new life, and sets her eyes on Marshal and Ted.
Bailey has a hard time getting used to how differently she's treated at work.
1433121.content:
"...a female version of myself!" There was a flash of light from the coin, and suddenly everything was different. Barney's apartment was bright and colorful, while still being just as ostentatious and over-the-top, with pink and yellow replacing the previously dominant darker colors. What was really different was, standing in Barney's place was a woman. She had long blonde hair, a gorgeous face with plump lips and expertly applied make-up, large breasts that were barely contained in the tank top she was wearing, a tight stomach shown off with the rest of her midriff, an ass that could clearly be seen through the boy shorts she had on, and legs that were completely free of hair and perfectly toned while still looking soft and curvy.

Then, a second later, they all knew who she was. This was Bailey Stinson, though when she was pulling her 'Bimbo Play', she went by Bunny. She'd been their friend for years, and had been with more men than anyone they knew. She often came off as kind of dumb or eccentric, but once they'd gotten to know her they had realized it was all a calculated act, one meant to lure in as many guys as possible.

At the same time, they still remembered Barney, and the conflicting sets of memories were definitely weird. Bailey smiled at them all, showing off her perfect pearly white teeth. "See! I'll be Bailey for a week, and by the end of it if any of you feel like I'm a 'slut' or think of me as more gross than guy me, I'll owe Lily five hundred bucks!"
1433121.title: Bailey Stinson

1441.content: In a small store within the walls of Ba Sing Se, two magical coins sit on a shelf, holding within them to shape the lives of those who hold them. That is, until someone found them...
1441.title: Benders with Coins

14413.content: Maybe one of the Water Tribe siblings?
14413.title: Other characters

144131.content: Should this be Sokka mid-Book 2 or post-Book 3?
144131.title: Choose a Time

1441311.content: Shortly after being kicked out of a local poetry group, which was completely over the line of them, Sokka found himself wandering the inner ring of Ba Sing Se, wondering how he was going to spend his day now. An antique shop, one with an ancient Water Tribe weapon in the window, piqued his interest, so that's where he went. It turned out the relic on display was some combination between axe and spear, but it was rotted out and not even close to worth the price the shopkeeper was asking. Feeling disappointed, Sokka wandered the shop until he found two coins, one gold and the other silver. "Become What You Seek." "Shape What You Were." Both looked appealing, but at the price the shopkeeper was asking for them, Sokka didn't feel comfortable buying more than one of them.
1441311.title: Water Tribe!

14413112.content: Sokka would never admit to anyone, not his sister, not his best friend Aang, and not their newest companion Toph, that he was jealous of them. It wasn't as if he wasn't aware that he was the most useless member of their group. Sure, he often did his best to think them through the situations they encountered, and he could fight well enough, but he was the joke, at least compared to them. He couldn't glide through the air or send boulders flying at his foes or heal the sick. He was just some guy, surrounded by the mighty. What if he'd been born a bender? One powerful enough to worth their time? When he thought of really powerful benders, Sokka thought of people like...
14413112.title: Another Life

choices: Aang shows up and Sorra tries to seduce the powerful boy.
Sorra sees Zuko at a tea shop and attacks, ready to kill the firebender.
144131121.content:
Walking the streets of Ba Sing Se, holding that coin, wondering what life would have been like if he had been born a powerful bender, for some reason all he could think of was Azula, princess of the Fire Nation. She was arrogant to the extreme, but she was the best, right? The coin he carried in a pocket began to glow brightly, and in an instant Sokka was someone completely different. He was a young woman of around the same age, late teen years approaching true adulthood, with an athletic build that emphasized combat over beauty. His skin was the same shade of Water Tribe brown, but far smoother and more well-kempt than it had been before. More than his gender, Sokka knew the life he had just been granted.

Though not technically royalty, Sorra of the Water Tribe enjoyed being called a princess. The most powerful waterbender in the last hundred years, Sorra outshine her sister Katara in both skill and beauty, though even Sorra herself knew her sister's social skills were useful on occasion. With a tactical mind and the surety of genius, Sorra was ecstatic to take the fight to the Fire Nation. Sokka shook his head, trying to sort out how different his life was now, and yet he, she, could feel the water in a nearby stream the same way she could feel her own arm, as if it was an extension of who she was. Was this what bending was like? It was difficult not to laugh, and Sokka wasn't even sure why she was stopping herself. She was now perfection incarnate!
144131121.title: The Water Tribe Prodigy

1442.content: While Steven and the Crystal Gems were in Empire City, their hotel (which was much more affordable this time) was only a block away from a thrift shop. It was pretty ordinary, but inside were two items of true Magic, coins that could shape people and reality. Who found them and bought them?
1442.title: Gems with Coins

choices: Pearl buys Become What You Seek.
Pearl buys Shape What You Were.
14422.content:
"Are you sure about this Pearl?" Amethyst asked, giving her teammate an odd look as she broke off from the group.

Unhappy with being questioned by the younger gem, Pearl turned away haughtily. "I'm my own gem, Amethyst, and I think this store looks quaint. I'll rejoin you all when I'm ready." And so she entered the store, almost hidden by it's more ostentatious neighbors. The truth was, the store reminded Pearl of Rose Quartz, with it's comfortable charm and homey atmosphere. She was only going to look around, but soon she found two coins, one gold and the other silver, that caught her eye. "Become What You Seek. Shape What You Were." For someone trying to become their own gem, their own person, who regretted so much of her past, Pearl wondered if buying one coin wouldn't be a good use of her money.
14422.title: Pearl of Her Eye

choices: Pearl's gem changes into a Rose Quartz.
Pearl's gem changes into a flawed Amethyst.
144222.content: When it came down to it, Pearl had more regrets with her past than she did with her present. It was with that in mind that she rejoined the main group, the coin hidden inside her gem. As they all toured the city, she listened to their group. Amethyst kept making fart jokes at passers by, acting childish and crude as usual. Peridot was lording her knowledge of gem technology over Connie. Bismuth was joking around with Garnet, the camaraderie coming easy to her. Lapis was keeping to herself, jumping into conversations when she seemed to have a good joke. And looking at Steven...as much as she loved her son, she couldn't help but think of Rose, of what it would be like if she was walking around with them as well.
144222.title: What Other Gems She Could Be

choices: Pearl quickly finds herself adapting to Thyst's life.
Pearl tries to explain what happened but no one believes her.
1442222.content:
More than any other Crystal Gem, Amethyst was on Pearl's mind. The two were complete contrasts in every way: different personalities, different pasts, different hard light body projections. Sometimes she made Pearl want to tear her hair out, but Pearl couldn't deny that she admired the Gen. Sometimes, if she was being completely honest with herself she often wondered if being made as a lowly Amethyst, even a malformed short one, would have been a better life than being a Pearl, traded from owner to owner.

To Pearl's immense surprise, her gem began glowing softly, and no one saw as the world around her reformed, her gem changing shape, hue, and classification. When the glow died down, Pearl found the world was looking much larger, and looking down she saw breasts much larger than usual, her form's color now a dark purple, and she was now wearing the T-shirt of a human band and what Pearl was told were called 'booty shorts'. The clothing was tight enough to show off Pearl's now pudgy stomach and thick thighs and ass.

An entire lifetime of new memories spawned in Pearl's mind: she was now Thyst, a gem made from the same kindergarten as Amy, and with the same defect. A little more smart and cautious than her sister, Thyst was still crude, rude, and carefree. She'd fallen in love with Rose Quartz, and was devastated by her loss but had made up for it by mothering Steven more than anyone else.

Pearl shook her head, standing on the sidewalk trying to figure out the two lives in her head, when the Crystal Gems turned back to look at her, confused. "Thyst? What's wrong?" Peridot asked, before coming closer, looking more compassionately at Thyst than she ever had at Pearl.
1442222.title: From Refined to Rough

choices: Amy suggests stopping somewhere for food, and Pearl enjoys eating.
Peridot and Thyst bond over science and more later that night.
14422221.content:
Normally, Pearl would have responded to concern with a kind smile and an excuse to brush off any worry about her, it was the way Pearls were trained to react to conflict: deflect through politeness and etiquette. Instead, despite it not being what she was trying to do, Pearl found herself shrugging casually and replying, "Eh, just thinking about junk." Then she started walking again, picking up the pace to rejoin the group, and found herself walking by Peridot's side.

Trying not to think about how differently she was acting, Pearl listened to Amy and Peridot talking, marveling at how odd it was so see both from a similar height, to see the world in general from such a low point of view. But slowly that wonder faded away. Instead, she became more interested in the argument the two gems near her were having. Peridot was trying to explain the plot of some episode of a human television program, but Amy was interrupting her with inane questions and comments at every turn. Before, Pearl may have been confused as to why Amy was acting this way, but Thyst understood that it was a joke to rile up Peridot. Unable to stop herself, Thyst joined in and it became even more hilarious. Pearl didn't laugh very often, but Thyst it seemed would chortle at nearly anything, and she couldn't deny it was fun. Living in the moment was almost addicting, compared to how before her head was always in the clouds.

It was the end of a long night for Gotham's dark protector. In just this one night Batman had to stop two bank robberies, seven mugging, disable more than a dozen cake-themed bombs left over from Joker's last campaign and had been thrown through two different walls, while trying to subdue Killer Croc. Now in the early hours of the morning he found himself totally exhausted, standing over the unconscious bodies of two thieves. They had tried to rob a small antique store, hoping that justice would go to bed early after a stressful night.

Before vanishing into the night again, Batman found himself having to catch his breath. In this rare moment of weakness something unusual happened: someone managed to pull on his cape. Expecting another assailant he whirled around, barely managing to stop his punch from connecting with the small, old lady, who thought it was a good idea to surprise the man who had just beaten two people senseless.

The lady didn't seem to notice the aborted attack."Oh deary me, this is quite the commotion for this early in the morning...", she said as she poked the would-be thieves with her walking stick. Hearing police sirens approaching, Batman attempted to leave the scene without further delay, but the old lady just tightened her grip on his cape as she continued: "Now now, a brave young man like you deserves a little compensation for their good deeds." with these words, she dropped her cane and began to rummage through the pockets of her to-large bathrobe.

Before Batman could object, she had found what see looking for. Extending a shaking hand, she presented two coin to the one golden, one silver, to the vigilante. Who found himself in a bit of a dilemma: He wanted to leave as soon as possible, ideally without accepting any gifts, but feared he would be unable to escape the old lady's grip without hurting her by accident. Always in the mood for a little shopping, she perused the store and bought two inscribed coins which, if they were made out of what they looked like they were, she got for a steal. 14513121.content:
Suddenly, Peter's cell phone, which he had left behind, began to ring. J Jonah Jameson, Peter's boss, was calling him, most likely about getting pictures of Spider-Man 'menacing innocent businessmen' or something. Scared to let it go to voicemail, MJ picked up the phone and answered the call without thinking. "Parker!" came the gruff sound of Jameson's voice. "The photographer for Fisk's trial came down with something, cancer I think. Anyway, I need you at the courthouse yesterday!"

Nervous, MJ lowered the pitch of her voice a few octaves and answered quickly, "Uh, yes sir, Mr. Jameson sir!"

Jameson didn't hang up. Instead the call continued, a silence hanging in the air that made MJ's heart almost stop. If he figured out this was her, and that Peter was somewhere else, he might get suspicious. "Is that really you, Parker? Your voice sounds different."

Mary Jane cleared her throat, and unbeknownst to her the vocal chords in it reconfigured into an exact match of Peter Parker's. "Sorry about that, sir, I had a frog in my throat." Mary Jane was impressed by how much better her impression had gotten, not noticing that it was now perfect, or that the perspective of the room was subtly changing as she grew taller.

She waited tensely, starting to feel her pants fit oddly as her legs lost their womanly curves and grew more muscular. "That's one hell of a frog!" MJ let out a sigh of relief, one that also expanded her waist a little, losing her overall hourglass shape and gaining a six pack in the process. "By the way, I wanted to talk to you about those pictures of the wall-crawler from yesterday."

More than anything else, Mary Jane wanted the call to end, both to save her the stress and so she could investigate the odd feelings she was getting, which were getting stranger as her breasts lost themselves in a sea of muscle as her shoulders widened and her pectorals replaced them. But she had to keep her cover up. "Sure, what's the issue, JJ?"

There was a grunt on the other end, clearly of annoyance at the nickname, and MJ couldn't help snickering under her breath as her arms became larger and stronger, her hands and fingers losing their dainty softness. "We published them because there wasn't much else to run, but I'm going to need more than the menace crawling on a brick wall! And the lighting was godawful!"

Mary Jane had no knowledge of photography, aside what few bits of jargon she had picked up from Peter, but as her beautiful face morphed into that of her husband's, and her long red hair faded into his short brown curls, she somehow managed to come up with, "Sorry about that, the flashlight I had with me was the wrong wattage, and I only barely managed to snap a few shots before he swung away."

"Hmm...Apology accepted! Now get to that trial, pronto!" The call ended just as Mary Jane's womanly parts folded out into their masculine equivalents. Desperate to know what had happened, she ran to the bathroom to see Peter, wearing his usual clothes, staring back!

It was a hot Thursday afternoon in El Paso, and Paco was bored out of his mind. His best friends were both nowhere to be found. Jaime was on same alien planet or something, and Brenda was studying. Sure, he could be at her place studying with her but...after an argument earlier in the day there was no chance of that happening. He actually liked her quite a bit, but they had a habit of saying the wrong things to each other, and this time it was him stepping on her toes. How was he supposed to know she was sensitive about being the token white girl of their group?

While wandering downtown, Paco saw an antique store he'd never noticed before and, without much else to do, entered it to see what they might have. It was pretty lame stuff all around, but a pair of old coins actually held some interest to him, for some reason. One was gold, the other silver, and they were both oddly enticing. Paco didn't have a lot of money on him, enough for one of them probably. Of course, paying for them wasn't the only way of getting them.

Taking the silver coin up to the register, it turned out to be pretty cheap, and he paid for it and left with it in his pocket. Sitting on a sidewalk later in the afternoon, he examined the coin further, and noticed for the first time the small writing on one side. "'Shape What You Were', huh?"

It made Paco think, about how things could have gone differently. He was happy with his life, but that didn't mean he didn't have regrets. If he could somehow reshape stuff that had already happened, change the course of events, what would he do with that power? He found himself thinking...

No sooner had Paco wondered this than the coin in his hands began glowing brightly, the luminescence increasing more and more until it blinded him. When he could see again, nothing looked different, but he suddenly had a completely new set of memories in his head alongside his original ones. These new memories were near identical to the life he'd lived, with two major exceptions: Brenda, the girl who had been his best friend for years, was no longer a white girl, but of Mexican descent like Paco; and because of this change, they hadn't had that argument earlier in the day, because she was no longer the odd one out in their group.

Paco was stunned that the coin had done what it had promised, Shaping his past in a different way. Trying to dig through these new memories more deeply, he realized this new Brenda was still a complete preppy nerd, and he was still infatuated with her, despite the fact they constantly annoyed each other and fought. 145231131.content:
It was a few months after that whole mess with the White Court, or I guess the latest mess with the White Court? Ugh, freaking vampires, man. Anyway, it was the morning, and I was waiting for grasshopper to get out of school so we could work on her training more. 'What's that?' you may be asked, 'How does magic superstar Harry Blackstone Copperfield Dresden not having anything to do?' Well, first off, where did you learn my Name? And second of all, I'm kind of a boring guy. I was between cases, and trust me, I don't have a lot going on socially. With nothing else to keep my mind occupied, I went on a little walk.

People are too down on Chicago, if you ask me. Sure, it's dirty, and crowded, and the mob's got their fingers in way too many pies, but it's home. And, not three blocks from my hole-in-the-wall apartment, there was a thrift shop. It was a great place to find paperback books, my favorite hobby, and the owner's a swell guy. Just as I'd picked up a full load of books and was heading to the register, I saw a couple of old coins sitting on a shelf. My heart stopped for a second, but after I checked it was clear neither was an ancient Roman denarius I picked them up. They had inscriptions on them...Become What You Seek...Shape What You Were...they sounded magical to me, and with that in mind I reached out a little with my mystical senses, and quickly felt the thrum on some heavy duty mojo. I bought the coins and took them back home with me, before sitting down with my old pal Bob the Skull and asking him, "What in the hell are these?"

After a few minutes of inspection and indignant snarking, the knowledge spirit living in the skull turning its orange eyelights to me and replied, "I don't know, boss." That threw me for a loop: Bob knew a lot, which meant these things were either really obscure or recently created. "I can tell you this: there's nothing immediately dangerous waving a red flag at me, so I'd say experimenting with them is the best idea."
145231131.title: Thrift Stores

145231131112.content:
Rather than study these newly acquired magical coins, which I knew would have been the smart/sane thing to do, I looked at a clock, saw I had five hours until the padawan arrived, and just decided not to. I have a lot of long days, and since it was looking like this might be the rare smooth sailing sort of afternoon, I felt like I had a date with Pawn of Prophecy. I slipped the coins into a pocket as I climbed the stairs into my apartment's living room and threw myself bodily onto my worn, comfy couch, let out a yawn, and began reading.

What I didn't know at the time was that the coins I had slipped into my pocket, while not containing any ancient fallen angels, were the kind that paid attention to what the person owning them said and did. Words and actions have larger meaning in the magical community, especially to the person doing it. I was purposely shirking my duties as a wizard to relax and enjoy myself, and I knew it. It was the kind of behavior I associated with teenagers, who in my experience are all too quick to take the easy way out and put off what needs to be done.

At that point in my life, the avatar of such actions had become my apprentice, the young Molly Carpenter. She was a good good who had made some bad choices, and I almost laughed to myself as I began the book, peering at the world map on the first page, that I was definitely making a Molly move. The coin, specifically the gold one, as I later found out, made some kind of psychic connection with its owner, and was activated whenever they did anything they consciously knew was outside of their usual behavior.

I'll be honest, I was really engrossed in my book. So engrossed, in fact, that I didn't notice as my body began to change. It was only after the fact that I realized my height was truncated, my masculinity turned into femininity, breasts grown, booty acquired, clothing altered, and sex changed. About two chapters in, I shifted a little in my seat as I began to feel like the book was getting a little dull, and felt the bouncing and jiggling of the boobs on my chest. Moving the book to get a better angle, I looked and saw, clad in a stylish t-shirt and a bra, I had my very own breasts just sitting there. Looking further down, the jeans I'd had on had become some sort of leggings. Or jeggings? I don't know. Regardless, there I was, laying on the couch and suddenly a woman.
145231131112.title: Immature Decision

1452311311121.content:
I let out a huff, one that came out way too high pitched for my tastes, and rose from my relaxation. The book I was reading stayed on the couch, for later consumption, and I did my best to think about baseball and old grandma's rather than the jiggling my chest and backside were doing as I climbed down the trapdoor back to the lab. Bob the Skull didn't react at all, which was good considering I didn't look like myself, but in a breathy voice I snapped, "Bob you bonehead, wake up! Not dangerous my ass!"

"And what a sweet one it is, Harry," the spirit of intellect replied as his eyelights lit up once again, focusing lecherously at my new form. "A complete transfiguration into a different human body, fascinating. Was it on accident, or were you secretly more feminine than you ever let me know?"

Anger flared through me and before I could stop myself I reached out with one hand and shouted "Forzare!" A blast of pure kinetic energy shattered a mug filled with pencils sitting just next to Bob, and I hoped he understood exactly where the line was with me at that moment. Setting my dainty jaw tightly, I grumbled, "I don't have any mirrors, Bob, so tell me what the damages are."

A cough came from the skull, which was pretty weird considering he didn't have lungs, and after a few seconds of looking at me he said, "You're jailbait, Harry. You've got bodacious boobs, a thick ass, a gorgeous face, and it's clear to anyone looking at you that you aren't legal yet. Though I don't think most men will care." The thought of a man looking at me, getting hard with desire for my feminine form, came out of nowhere and to my surprise is felt good. Like being told you're a sex god kind of good. "What exactly were you thinking about when this happened?"

I thought about that, doing my best to shove any obtrusive, non-Harry thoughts into a box labeled "DO NOT OPEN", and realized something. "I was putting off doing any experiments to relax and enjoy myself. I consciously knew I was putting off something necessary, and for a second I thought about Molly...that can't be it, can it?"

"I told you, Harry, I've got no clue. Leave the coins with me and I'll do my best to figure out what's going on. In the mean time, do whatever you want. This is a chance to see how the other half lives, boss."

After leaving the coins with the bonehead, I headed back up the ladder into my living room and struggled to figure out what to do with myself. My day off was basically ruined. There was no way I could go outside, not looking like this, and reaching out to any of my friends wasn't the best idea considering I'd have to explain my current conundrum. Even if they believed me, which they might not, I'd never live down accidentally magicing myself into jailbait. Under self-imposed house arrest, I went to lay back down on the couch and read my book, but a few pages in I had to set it down. It then hit me that I was in a teenage girl's body, an especially hot teenage girl's body, with boobs and everything. Not only that, but there wasn't any ethical dilemma that would have come if I was some kind of exact copy of someone else. I'll be honest: teenage hormones were flooding my brain at that point, and when combined with the remaining masculinity in my brain, it's pretty obvious what I did next. I learned a lot about the female body that day, and just as my fingers were drenched in my juices, reeling from my third orgasm as I splayed across the couch, I heard someone using keys to open my apartment door.

To my surprise, what immediately followed was Thomas putting on his pants and ditching the apartment, and me, as fast as he could. I only found out a few months later that he'd thought I was another one of those young people in over their heads, staying at my place for safety while Harry Dresden, badass wizard, was out fighting evil. Focusing on my inner Dresden, I gathered up what energy I still could and gave the skull a hard stare. "One, I'm still Harry, Bob, and if you give me any more little nicknames I'm handing you to Mab. Two, my virginity in this body is intact, thank you very much. Three, don't ever ask me about what just happened. Four, give me some info on the coin."

"Alright then, Herr Fuhrer, I think I've mostly figured out the enchantment on these coins." I was interested enough in what he had to say that I decided to ignore the Hitler joke. "It seems that whenever a mortal is in possession of the coin, any choices they make with their Free Will are closely examined by the coin, and compared to their sense of self. If the person does something they relate in any way to a certain person or a stereotype about certain types of people, the coin transforms them into what they were thinking of, and it affects the mind as well." I'd already seen that in action myself. "Conscious thought won't affect it either, it's entirely subconscious. If you want to change back, you'll need to do things that you think are stereotypically Harry Dresden."

1452311311121211131.content:
It's rare to be forced to self-examine yourself as much as I was being forced to. I was racking my brain, trying to figure out what I could do that was stereotypically 'me'. In the end, I kept going back to my favorite place in the world to spend time, the home of the greatest beer in the world and a damn good steak sandwich. Not exactly in the mood to try and drive to MacAnally's, considering I was in the body of a teenager whose face didn't match my license, I decided to walk to the pub, which I sometimes did anyway when the weather was nice. I mean, it wasn't, but what's a girl to do?

Speaking of my new sex, none of my clothes would fit me, so I was stuck in the skinny-jeans tank top combo that left my 'goods' on display for anyone willing to risk statutory. I got a few catcalls and comments, and I tried to feel upset at them, but something about this new persona apparently really liked being hit on like that. Once at the pub, I was happy even with the light air conditioning inside, as it proved quite the respite from the overwhelming heat outside. Brushing the sweaty bangs out from in front of my eyes, I told Mac, "I'll have some of your beer and a steak sandwich." He didn't question me for an ID, which upon reflection made me wonder if the bartender somehow knew it was me. Before too long, I was drinking the finest alcohol on earth and chomping down on a delicious sandwich, hoping it would change me back. Unfortunately, that wasn't the effect I received.
1452311311121211131.title: Beer Body

choices: ...heading to the mall and hanging out.

14523113111212111312.content:
The big problem with magic like this, the kind that really digs into your subconscious and brings to live your unspoken assumptions, is that it makes you realize how insanely stupid you really are, how unrealistic and awful your internal prejudices can be. See, I did change as I downed my beer, suddenly getting the urge to chug it in one big gulp, but I stayed being a teenage girl. What was new was...well, almost everything else. As I would learn quite soon, my hair style changed, becoming one of those trendy new styles where one side of the head was buzzed down to next to nothing, the rest of it longer and more wild. An earring appeared in my right earlobe, which was suddenly pierced, and my clothes lost a lot of their mass as they became more skimpy.

See, as it turns out, the coin was hitting on the fact that, if I saw a teenage girl just walk into a pub and start drinking beer and eating a steak sandwich, I wouldn't think "Hey, that's Harry Dresden in a girl's body!". No, I would think, "Wow, kids today are out of control." I know, I know, I'm an old fart who needs to loosen up. Well, I wasn't anymore, at the time. No, as I looked down at my changes, unbeknownst to me, my brain was changing further, making me the kind of delinquent I looked like. This whole plan had been a complete bust, and now I had that tingling feeling of being kind of buzzed. So when I considered what to do next, I didn't question it much when my mind came up with...

...heading to the nearest high school to scope out it's guy options. Again, in retrospect it seems obvious something was up, but at the time my brain was too fuzzy, both from the alcohol and the brain changes, to really notice. So I told Mac to put it on my tab, left the bar, and headed to a school that was a few blocks from where I was, and I got there just as school was letting out for the day.

My new personality had some kind of intrinsic radar for guys, and started noting the best options right away, discarding those who weren't worth my time. Too short, too fat, clearly gay. Only two guys I saw stuck out enough that I wanted to go approach them. There was this jock, broad shouldered quarterback type with a square jaw and abs you could cut glass on, who just looked scrumptious to me. The other guy wasn't nearly as stereotypically attractive, but was instead a tall guy in casual clothes that hung off his thin frame, including a Spider-Man t-shirt. The guy reminded me of me at that age, and some part of me wanted to help him out with a roll in the hay.

info.brief_description: Two coins hold the power to change the wielder's form and mind.
info.description:
There exists, in some forgotten thrift store, two coins. The shopkeeper knows not their true value, and will happily give it away for a pittance.

“Become What You Seek”: This gold coin, with its title inscribed on the surface, has a light mental enchantment on it, making those who take it want to keep it on their person at all times. That is nothing, however, compared to its true purpose. While having the coin with them, the users choices become something more: at moments that go against the way they normally act, they will physically and mentally transform to fit their action. The user will remember who they used to be, but as the actions stack up and the changes continue, users tend to prefer what they've become to what they were. However, at no point does reality change to fit their forms, with the exception of clothing changes.

“Shape What You Were”: This silver coin, also with its title inscribed, has none of the mental compulsions of its sibling. Instead, were one to hold it and concentrate on a different way of living, something they could have done that they didn't, or any other kind of other life, reality will reshape to fit the wish. The user and those watching the change will keep their memories of the previous reality, but all others will never know how things once were. The person changed, usually physically and mentally, will over time begin to identify more and more with their new world and see their true past as more and more of a dream, knowing it was real but feeling distant from it.

Go as hard as you want, but please no making only one option and always leave the last option as “Something else” or anything to that effect. Please also be aware I also object to content that is offensive in content or whose standards of grammar and spelling are under par. By offensive, I mean overtly and cruelly prejudiced content, incredibly violent content, and sexual content involving characters far below the age of consent. Offending content will be obliterated.

Adding substantively (250 words or more) to an existing storyline will give you gift points equal to your word count, so long as it does not violate previously mentioned rules.

Thanks to TFWright for the idea that inspired this interactive, namely the main plot of their hit visual novel “Pirate’s Fate”. It’s on Steam, and if you like this sort of stuff you should definitely give it a look, maybe buy it.
